DOC.brief_title: Statin Preventing Hepatocellular Carcinoma Recurrence After Curative Treatment
DOC.detailed_description: This multi-center double-blind randomize placebo-controlled trial . A total 240 patient HCC BCLC stage 0 A enrol 8 hospital Taiwan . After complete ablation hepatic resection tumor ( ) , participant randomize 1:1 receive either atorvastatin 10mg daily ( intervention group ) match placebo ( control group ) 3 year . During 3-year period , patient monitor recurrence HCC dynamic compute tomography ( magnetic resonance image ) every 4 month . They follow death , withdrawal participation , study termination , 3 year ablative treatment . The primary endpoint compare 3-year cumulative incidence recurrent HCC intervention group control counterpart . Secondary endpoint occurrence clinical complication relate hepatic decompensation ( include gastroesophageal variceal bleeding , spontaneous peritonitis , hepatic encephalopathy , hepatorenal syndrome , hepatopulmonary syndrome ) , liver-related mortality , all-cause mortality .
